title: [spurious] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'slice index starts at 24722962 but ends at 13279232', src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:2680:5

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-cranelift
labels.description: Things relevant to the [future] cranelift backend

body:

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.42.0-nightly (175631311 2020-01-10) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -Z panic-abort-tests -Z codegen-backend=/Users/bjorn/Documents/rustc_codegen_cranelift/target/release/librustc_codegen_cranelift.dylib -Z force-unstable-if-unmarked -C debuginfo=2 -C panic=abort -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
end of query stack
error: could not compile `hashbrown`.

This is with a custom codegen backend, but that shouldn't matter as it doesn't modify metadata reading and writing.
